#combining 2 csv files

s <- read.csv("skandia1.csv",header=T,sep=",")
s2 <- read.csv("skandia2.csv",header=T,sep=",")
s3 <- rbind(s,s2)
View(s3)
names(s3)

#retrieve the number of rows
length(s3)

#accesses all the values in the 3rd row
s3[3,]

#accesses the value in the 3rd row, 3rd column
s3$X.3[3]

#change column names
colnames(s3)=c("Date", "Transaction", "Amount", "Account Balance")

#writing Na into empty rows
s[s==""] <- NA
s2[s2==""] <- NA
s3[s3==""] <- NA

#determines if there are any NA rows in the data frame
complete.cases(s)

#prints to console all of the rows with data
s2[complete.cases(s2),]

#created a new data frame removing all NA values
skandia<-na.omit(s3)
